author: eggfatlatte
review: There is much to be desired for the app but the last update made the app unusable. After each session the mendi icon shows up and gets stuck there. Only way to get pass this screen is to close the app and restart it. I see other people are experiencing the same behavior. Seems like this got passed QA somehow. Not terribly impressed with the app. Please fix this ASAP or I‚Äôll have to move on to alternatives.

While the training session is good I‚Äôd really like new experiences that leverages the headset.

author: AgentM3
review: The device is super simple to use and It‚Äôs comfortable when snug on your forehead. The ‚Äúgame‚Äù is interesting because it‚Äôs a cool visual representation of my ability to focus. Another way to put it is that it‚Äôs a visual representation of your brains activity when attempting to focus on a task or a visual representation of the brain during meditation. I really like the feedback and the ability to compare past sessions to current. It took about a week or so before I really started noticing small improvements in focus and I do mean small subtle but effective improvements. With patience and consistency I feel strongly that this device will really help with my focus, anxiety, stress and sleep. It‚Äôs going to take time and I won‚Äôt develop some cool super powers but I am finally able to train my brain and see/feel the improvements.
title: Workout for my Brain

author: Williston North Dakota oil boom!!
review:
I‚Äôve been using Mendi off and on for the past 6 1/2 months now. As long as I can stay consistent I truly feel like it is helping I‚Äôm not sure. I fully understand it yet, but I know my day-to-day activities, demeanor attitude, buisness and overall well-being has improved.
I‚Äôm excited to see what the next six months look like.

author: Crsmalley
review: I see more and more little improvements in myself the longer I use it. Like, I am more willing to get things done that I dislike doing around the house or with my budget. I am becoming more focused at work. I notice I am getting better at not being triggered at some things and I am recovering quicker at the things that do still get me. I have been using it for about a month now. The other day I was hit with hard information and I was actually able to say, I am done worrying about this tonight and chose to go to sleep and actually slept without my mind racing all night or preventing me from going to sleep. That was huge. I also am noticing more when I am being critical towards other. Like it is bringing awareness to me so I can change it. I think it will also help me change it the more I use it. I catch myself breathing more through stressful moments helping them be less stressful. This thing is a miracle that come in a box. It is so easy to use and I have my whole family using it. Thank you mendi!! I have done neurofeedback before to help with a head injury. I am so grateful for the price of this vs that, and the convenience of having it be in the home or wherever I want to do it. Thank you thank you thank you! Using this device is literally helping my marriage get better!! Bit by bit as we both use it. Those reading this, you have to give it the time and consistency but it is such an easy thing to do. I do miss a day or two a week and still get amazing results so you dont have to be perfect but it is sooo worth the little effort it takes to do it!
title: Very helpful!!!

review: Thank you this has been helping me focus more in school and my mental heath, also after when I go to sleep I‚Äôm able to get better sleep and thank you I love Mendi -josue

author: Tina K11
review: But the app could use some minor improvements. The overall activity snapshot at the end could have neural activity numbers going up the side of the graph making it more accurate for showing how a session actually looked for brain activity. That way those graphs would show something more real. A graph that only shows time along the bottom and nothing going up the side is not a reflection of the actual data. Also if the Mendi app could show battery life of the headband that would greatly improve frustration when the headband lights up as if it should work but the app doesn't connect.  I have also had to turn off my phone to reset the app which gets glitchy from time to time.  Lastly the performance, commitment, and activity circles on the top what are they actually showing? I understand commitment but the other two are vague in what they are relating to.   Otherwise I love the Mendi and will continue to use it as it is helping me understand what affects my mental cognition ‚ù£Ô∏è

author: ConradIII
review: i used this app for the first time today and i think it is very good. good info, good design and easy to use. the only thing negative was that it took me a bit to figure out how to connect the headset to my phone with bluetooth. be sure to "allow" the app to use your bluetooth in the settings of your phone. it seems obvious but i have many bluetooth devices and i don't think i ever had to do that. if i did, the app told me i had to and this one did not.
title: better than i expected

author: Micarona
review:
I‚Äôm a medically retired firefighter/medic with diagnosed ADHD, PTSD, general anxiety, and depression.  I underwent treatments including EMDR, hypnotherapy, CBT, and DBT.  I was prescribed alpha stimulation to help manage nightmares, irrational fears, suicidal ideations, and sleep deprivation (essentially shock therapy).  I have learned that meditation and exercise historically helped me the most.  Then Mendi came screaming across feed. I bought in because of a rudimentary familiarity with brain function in a PTSD brain (with skepticism). 

Ultimately, I love this tool and am finding myself meditating with it more than without it.  I love seeing how my sessions are monitored.  I also feel more relaxed after my sessions.  I had my 10th session over the last two weeks today and I can visualize how my focus is improving.

I can‚Äôt confirm Mendi is responsible for helping me quit chewing, but my curbed desire for alcohol and nicotine appear to have a correlation with the use of Mendi. I am far less interested in stimulants than I have been in a long time.  

I am recommending this tool for further investigation from my union to aid in first responder mental health training and treatments.
title: Firefighter/Medic

author: hgerm
review: So in the 20 days I‚Äôve noticed some better focus at work. I‚Äôm able to stay on one project longer without feeling the need to jump to another. I‚Äôm remembering more of my dreams after waking up too.  Looking forward to some more progress to give a five star.
title: At 20 days

author: geekglasses
review: Exceptional device. Mendi has helped me feel better, experience a comfortable calm, and sleep better. Mendi has helped me experience my thoughts in what I can only describe as a more manageable rather than hectic way. I can‚Äôt explain it, it‚Äôs like it‚Äôs easier to think and I don‚Äôt need as much energy to think. I love the breath work before each session because it helps me focus and prepare for my session so that I‚Äôm present and participating. It‚Äôs a comfortable device, easy to set up. I‚Äôm super curious to see how I do over a longer period of time and look forward to improving my brain health.
title: Feel better, calm, clarity

author: Probly steve
review: I have only just begun using Mendi, so I can‚Äôt speak to results yet. I find the app, informative, and interesting. However, I wish there were more information about the scores. The explanation on the website is filled with vague hedges. Basically, it says your score doesn‚Äôt matter as much as your improvement. But it doesn‚Äôt even quantify what a good improvement would be. While I understand a ‚Äúgood‚Äù score might vary widely depending on age and preexisting health conditions (adhd, depression,‚Ä¶ etc),  and lifestyle (exercise, diet, substance use/abuse, etc.), it would be great if they could present us with some averages and means( baselines based on age and categories people self identify they are trying to improve). They must have a significant amount of data at this point, and the fact that they are not willing to share this data does not instill me with confidence.
title: Just started, but I wish there were more info.

review:
So it helped me get back to mindfulness. It has already helped me identify new pre-flow creative state triggers. However after few months of use it is no longer helpful.
I could get the same good score on two sessions. The first session I had high neutral activity, oxygen and focus. The second session I had poor scores in all these areas. So the score really only measures commitment to the app which is unhelpful for neurofeedback and brain training.

review: If you‚Äôre looking to make the jump and play with neurofeedback this is a good gateway. Cost of entry is not very preventative and no subscription fee.
title: Review

author: MoMan12345
review: The device is absolute garbage! I tested it over a few days in a controlled environment and did back to back training session. The noise to signal ratio is massive. You can move your head or a slight raise in eyebrows is detected as a massive surge in neuronal activity! Have requested a return.
title: Absolute garbage

author: chinchilla_12
review: I have been using for 3 months really starting to feel the progression I am staying calm helps me focus I have severe ADD it‚Äôs been helping really love it can‚Äôt wait to see where it all leads
title: The Medi is fantastic

author: Shriner#2023
review: App has been great. I have had no problems with it.
title: Mendi Training

author: Judydogdoc99
review: I have struggled with attention deficit as long as I can remember. This app is an excellent way to track my attention patterns and variability every day. The app has a lot of great articles and videos to help the user understand neuro feedback, the Mendi device, and how our sleep, diet, and exercise affect our brain health. I highly recommend this app to anyone who is interested in exploring brain health. I‚Äôve only been using the app for about a month, so I won‚Äôt know conclusively if it‚Äôs helping for another month or so, but I have seen a difference and a change in my ability to focus.
title: Great app and device!

author: Flippyfel
review: ‚ÄúInvalid database object‚Äù error. Please fix and I‚Äôll update my review!
title: Cannot sign in or sign up

author: Lukatronic
review: The training game is deceptively simple, almost bare bones, but the real changes and challenges happen within! The headband is solid and has had no issues I'm aware of... I recommend this to anyone who wants to try biofeedback for the brain. The price for entry is a little high but the app has loads of info and good badges to keep it fun.
title: Solid consistent brain training platform

author: Nick Etsitty
review: I have tried meditating many times over the years but couldn‚Äôt keep with it to really make it part of my daily routine.  This gave me the structure I lacked and the feedback helped me keep motivated.  I have not only kept Mendi up, I have recently been able to incorporate other forms of meditating too.  It all started with Mendi.
title: It was just enough structure to get me on the path.

author: Josh Risky Jones
review: Has really helped me get my uncontrolled epilepsy and medication resistant seizures to a manageable point where I‚Äôm not going to the hospital ER 3-4 times per month for grand mal episodes. It helped me improve my focus and get in touch with my emotions as well.
title: Great app and device

author: Bakari889
review: This app has improved a a lot with the last update. There is now a breath work feature before the training game. They added a mindset coaching pathway. Also I have not experienced anymore crashes. I‚Äôm using this on my work phone. The android version of this app is seriously behind the IOS edition.
title: Great Since Update

author: kam7459
review: Mendlin.io has helped me.  I feel strong after a few sessions.
title: Like the application

author: Divine Goddess Mother
review: I have ADHD, C-PTSD, and I often feel I am autistic. This tool and app have helped me to focus, feel calm, safely express emotions and I am beyond grateful. Everyone needs to utilize this!
title: Amazing Tool

author: BuddhaMaitreya
review:
I use the Mendi daily. I appreciate its simple functions but would really appreciate the ability to do heart mind meditation.
It‚Äôs designed for it but not utilized .
title: Heart mind meditation

author: Ddelgr
review:
I suffer from major depression, anxiety and recently been diagnosed with ADHD. I bought this band hoping it could help alleviate some of the stuck feelings I have each and everyday. I believe Mendi has been a positive addition to my routine, especially if I can get myself to stick with it. It‚Äôs very easy to just try it out and start and I have had no major issues with it. So far so good! Thank you for creating something that is within reach, especially in the neurofeedback world! 

Some things I do wish is seeing more data related to what my brain or blood flow may be doing. I‚Äôm a very data oriented person so, any data for me to observe and utilize would be beneficial. Also health kit syncing would be awesome. I‚Äôd love to be able to give a result set to a Dr. or Psychologist!
title: Neurofeedback that is not out of reach

author: do better mendi
review: This was recommended by an mlb psychologist . Doesn‚Äôt seem to hold up in terms of quality or support. The app is buggy to say the least.
title: Device doesn‚Äôt hold a charge and app keeps crashing

author: 1guera
review: I bought it for me my parents, my friends and my family that is how much I believe in this product!
title: Best thing

author: Cyman 513
review: Easy to follow and definitely makes a difference.
title: Lots of fun.

author: YippyChaiYay
review:
If nothing else, this device helps you train your positive thinking muscles and to let go and overcome your negative thinking patterns! When the ball starts to fall, your negative thinking really kicks in and this is a great tool to help notice when it does and to try different thoughts out. I‚Äôve been using mendi for about one year now and I am convinced my day turns out better when I use mendi. Typically use it once a day for a 10min session. Using it is almost like an active meditation in that you seem to do better with a light concentration rather than willful concentration. When I try to ‚Äúwill‚Äù the ball up, it doesn‚Äôt seem to work to well. But when I focus on a specific spot on my body and relax my breathing, it seems to rise better. I dont know why that is or if it is unique to me. 
But I like using mendi, and I like the ‚ÄúJourneys ‚Äú section they added. Winnerminds has some good meditations to go along with mendi. 
I recommend anyone getting it.
title: Brain Gym

author: JMathhelpsyouwin
review: Always struggled with keeping sustainable focus during meditation. Also great to get the feedback. Feel less relaxed than after meditation. Probably need 5 mins of interoceptive meditation also afterwards.. Love this thing!
title: Meditation Measured

author: QQQQQZÓå®
review:
I have an IPad Pro.  Large screen.  Totally would have loved to have put this on my iPad.  Hopefully, that will change.  
I haven‚Äôt used it enough yet to really say if I like it or not.  I used it last night and then tonight, I forgot my phone downstairs so I thought, no biggie.  I can just put it on my iPad Pro.  It‚Äôs even better because of the screen size.  That was a fail.   I hope they can fix that.  
I am excited to use this daily though.  I need help focusing.
title: What?  I can‚Äôt download to my iPad?

author: The pillZ
review:
So cool that we have home devices like this now. I think you could have better on boarding baked into the sessions when you start, I had to seek out how the positive reinforcement actually works and its explained in day 4 of a video series, but that info should be drip fed through the first few sessions because it helps you immensely.

After I started trying to ‚Äúfeel happy‚Äù when ball goes up, and ‚Äúfeel bad‚Äù when ball goes down, thats what trains the subconscious to prefer better blood flow.

That part was missed, and took me 2 weeks to figure out as I was poking around and playing with the app.

My gf asked how does it work? I had no idea and couldn‚Äôt explain it to her‚Ä¶ but now I can because I watched that video series.
title: Amazing

author: Hibaradaj
review: Not entirely sure how it works, but I can feel the positive effects just after initial weeks or so. Thank you for an amazing swift app and great product overall!
title: Feeling it

author: ShaTipRN
review: It is a challenge to try to stay focused. But with Mendi I am seeing improvement since I first started. I can also see a difference in my score if I have been drinking  or I‚Äôm tired or sad.
title: Helping my brain

author: aasweet3
review: We got the Mendi almost a year ago during Black Friday, we got a $100 discount which was great. I really like that the app is free and several people can use the same device without having to pay any additional fees for subscriptions. At first I was spotty with my Mendi practice but as I have become more consistent I have noticed greater improvement with my overall scores. Beyond the scores, I am an adult male with ADHD and have found that my mood has improved as well as my ability to focus on everyday tasks. I would recommend the Mendi for anyone who has a desire to improve their mental health. I would love to see Mendi introduce more games so there is a variety in the brain training. It would also be  cool to see more statistics to track improvement over time.
title: Consistency is key!

author: AlphaMike1730
review: Great app for all.
title: Perfect

author: AAR NYC
review: This is an amazing neuro feedback app that has been very helpful in my everyday life.
title: Mendi app

author: amonof4
review: I really appreciate the simplicity of Mendi yet the profound changes it can make.  Also, the design is very durable.  The value is fantastic!  Thank you!  Keep up the great work!
title: Great device/ Great company

author: Functional Neurologist
review: I use Mendi and I recommend it to my patients.
title: Dr. Daniel McBride

author: Rosyc11
review: I have loved starting my day with a Mendi session. I am a 3rd grade teacher and anything that can help me calm and support my mind is important to me. I love that Breathwork and reflection have added. That quick check in has really enhanced my Mendi practice.
title: A Great Way To Start My Day

author: Dont.Be.Deuby
review: 100% worth it. App keeps improving but not as much as my brain training and focus. The Mendi effect is real. I like the bonus meditations and the new breath work. Just 10 minutes a day and you will notice a difference after a week or so. My 8 years has been doing this and it‚Äôs been great in helping train his mind to focus and pay attention. Funny thing is he thinks he is playing a game. This is cool!
title: Worth it

author: Danmor321
review: This is incredible , it has impacted me in deep ways . I can definitely see how it will have a profound impact on who ever uses it and eventually in human life as a whole
title: Mendi will change the world

author: Gracesky11004
review: I love this product. I got mendi to help improve my concentration. I use it everyday as part of my morning routine. Within two weeks I noticed that my focused improved. I highly recommend this product to anyone struggling with concentration issues! It‚Äôs a game changer. I also love that the app comes with informative videos that explain how mendi works on the brain.
title: Mendi is the best!

author: whizdoms
review:
When I bought the Mendi, I told myself that i couldn‚Äôt buy one more thing, unless I was going to use it. My new friend for life.

Since my dad had dementia, and I‚Äôve been experiencing signs of it, I wanted to do everything I could to retrain my brain and give my brain the best opportunity of living out its best life for the remaining years that I have.

I‚Äôm still very new to Mendi, but I already feel a difference in how I sense  how I feel when my over analytical thinking mind begins to take over. 

Mendi is definitely my new friend for life and I look forward to many new journeys ahead!
title: Mendi is my new friend for life!

author: ttsiege
review: Really helps me stay centered and calm
title: Great app and device

author: Mindfulgirl1111
review: This app is amazing, it has helped my anxiety and throught/response patterns. Helps me to sleep and I‚Äôm my kid loves it too!
title: Incredible

author: Guinness71
review: Doesn‚Äôt work a few months after purchase. Not much response from customer service. They might be too busy rolling in all the money they have made. Maybe try a mindfulness app instead
title: Very glitchy

author: Vibing
review: Before the update the app was working; however since the new update the app crashes right before training and need to restart which is very annoying. Please fix the crashing issue.
title: App crashing

author: EaganRackley
review: Crashes every time I use it after the update and there doesn‚Äôt seem to be a way to go back :( Now my Mendi is just a very expensive pape weight - except not even a very good one because it‚Äôs not that heavy :/
title: Crashes with 1.23.6

author: Atrianata
review: Does not starts and only show context and history of the previous activity. No way to fix it
title: Glitchy app

author: Dr. Murican
review: There is no variation to the training. So even just after a few days of using it, it gets boring and I zone out. Also, I was just doing a session and somebody in the background started talking about what the mendi score is toward the of it and then the app froze and the 10+ minutes of training did not complete and got stuck on ‚Äúloading‚Äù. Also, I am considering getting a refund because the device doesn‚Äôt seem to get a correct signal from my head half the time so then you see tremendous falls of 20-30% without me being able to do anything about it‚Ä¶ until the sensors catch a signal again. I think this product is simply not ready for customers. The sensors/ system need to be better and the app as well needs debugging and much more variety to the training to keep the customer engaged. I am disappointed.
title: It‚Äôs buggy, there is no variety, and the device sensors don‚Äôt work well

author: V~!
review:
I‚Äôm very skeptical about this concept. Application works well and didn‚Äôt crash at all, however the band works equally well when worn on my head or over my knee or over my pillow.
Actually it gave better score when worn over the pillow. Customer service response was quick and full of explanations why it‚Äôs ok. Sorry, not buying it. My Garmin watch with optical sensor doesn‚Äôt read HR when removed from my wrist.
title: App works, not so sure about head band

author: Carlon Arrington
review: Not good for much. I regret spending money on it.
title: Not good for much.

author: WilliamLewis96
review: I recently bought a Mendi headset, I think this app works really well. One item I wish the app would do, is write mindfulness data to HealthKit, so your time shows up within the health app.
title: Works well!

author: Brownian Motion
review: I got the Mendi about 10 days ago and I‚Äôve been using it every day. I‚Äôm still figuring out how to control the ball - clearly that requires some mental experimentation. I believe I‚Äôve made progress and almost all days, my assessment of the session matches, qualitatively, my Mendi score. There were some surprises tho. On my first session this afternoon, I was thinking about something stressful at work and became very agitated. I looked at the ball and, during that time, it was gyrating wildly, going steeply up for a little bit and then falling steeply into the depths. It was like the ball was riding needles up and down! I fully expected my Mendi session to have a low score, but to my surprise, I got my highest score ever at 90 and my highest ever area under the graph! That was puzzling and a little disturbing because I did not expect, or want, my scores to be high when I was agitated and my frontal lobe completely out of my conscious control! Not sure if this is an actionable item but i wanted to put it out there in the hope that it‚Äôs a useful tidbit. Couple fixes and changes I‚Äôd like: Id like to be able to see all my numbers and plots for a session even if it isn‚Äôt the best session of the day. Right now it only gives you hints of what your numbers could be by showing you part of each number, with no way of clicking on them and seeing them fully! The second is that the app has frozen on me a couple of times after using it, when I try to scroll up and down.
title: App needs work to make it more useful

author: Flyboy Instructor
review:
This app is hopeless. It is so user unfriendly. 
I can‚Äôt run new sessions. I can‚Äôt up the sessions.
I am returning the device because of this hopeless app
title: This app makes the device almost unusable

author: Uptownbrownny
review: Mendi has helped me with my focus and think it does what it claims.  But I have to say that their customer service is the worst. It matters because the software is buggy. It registers the wrong day, doesn‚Äôt recognize that I‚Äôve completed a session, and some of the scores appear random‚Äîthe exact same scores on the three metrics but different scores overall. I want to be a fan and talk it up, but the customer service department has gone out of their way to make that impossible.
title: Would have given five stars

author: NF-Guy
review: I‚Äôm a Ph.D pyschologist very familiar with neurofeedback and I was excited to try this device. Unfortunately I could not get it to work on my iPhone 12. It connected to the app but the sensors never turned on once the headband was in place. Very disappointed. NF-Guy
title: Would not fully connect

author: SharkRepair
review:
Hello! Thank you for your continued work on the app. I look forward to seeing it expand with more content and different games. I have a couple issues and suggestions:

I dislike the chime tone. It reminds me of casinos and I end up turning my volume all the way off to avoid it. A variety of tones to choose from or the option to turn off the chimes while still having the music would be great.
The visual display that comes up after a session rarely displays the Mendi score at this point. I have the most recent update. I usually receive a message instead to do a session or swipe to see my history. I can still see the individual metrics below, but the inconsistency and not knowing how to compare with previous results makes me less enthusiastic to use the app and has led to gaps in training. It seems to post the results twice, actually now that I look at it again, but the date is inaccurate. I trained today but not yesterday, however today‚Äôs results are displayed with both yesterday‚Äôs and today‚Äôs dates, yesterday having the visual Mendi score and today having the message to do a session or swipe left
title: Feedback for the devs

author: The1pictureguy
review:
I received my Mendi 2-12-22 and I cannot get past the email page in app. It would not send an email either. I requested a resend multiple times. I Checked junk section also, in case it got sent there. Nothing!!! Please fix now!!!!

Update: We finally got the app to work. I‚Äôm not sure how since it was so long ago.  I actually forgot to come update this review.  Working on using it regularly so we can see how it benefits us.
title: App not working

author: composingkeys
review: Mendi doesn‚Äôt have enough variety. It is currently only the ball game and one music piece. For something you are encouraged to do at least 3 times a week 5 minutes a session, I wish there was more. For the price, I feel this hurts the experience and desire to use it.
title: Not enough variety

author: Pbxs
review: But effective ‚Äî love the device itself, it‚Äôs designed so well.  App isn‚Äôt feature heavy, but it‚Äôs maturing; awesome product
title: Simple

author: MarqR
review:
Update:  I contacted support and was told that the delays on some screens was due to backend server load issues that are being addressed. This does seem to explain the issues I am/was seeing:

1) Initial screen when starting a session - the ‚Äúbutton‚Äù for selecting me vs a guest is slow to fill in with my name and let me start a session. 

2) ‚ÄúRotate to landscape‚Äù prompt is slow to respond after rotation and then load the start of a session. 

3) The end of a session appears hung, but does eventually load the concluding screens of a session. 

It would seem to make sense to display some sort of animation at these junctures that shows the user that the app is still running, and not broken. Perhaps some sort of background asynchronous communication/loading could also make the app appear more responsive. 

All told, I‚Äôm happy with the app and the Mendi headband device. I hope more customization of the session experience will be added in the future. 

It would be nice to have additional choices of background music, to play your own music, or turn off music. It might be nice to have a more beautiful background than the current sky/color gradient, such as actual natural imagery: sky, forest, or a coastal landscape. I wonder if some other changing focus image other than the spinning ball, like a fountain/jet of water, a point or sphere of light, or perhaps something purely aural - a fluctuating sound such a variable frequency filter over brown/white/pink noise. 

I‚Äôm still working with the system and look forward to getting better at using it, and hope the user experience will be improved/made more customizable. 

============
The Mendi app seems to be working well, but at the end of a training session the app hangs on a blank (colored, but no UI) screen. I need to go to the iOS app switcher, swipe it away, and restart it. The app shows that my session activity is recorded, but this clearly isn‚Äôt a good user experience. I‚Äôm doing a 10 minute session, running iOS 15.5, on an iPhone 13 Pro Max with 256 GB storage. The Mendi app version is v1.19.0.2205101542. Device model V4, Hardware version r2.1a-ty1, Firmware 1.0.2
title: Apps works well, but it is slow to load some UI

author: Bjorn E.H
review:
I have had  Mendi for a week now and here is my review. 

The device works well and I like it so far, very easy to use with a awesome design. 

However, the app has issues with the login page, I need to login several times to get in, it also takes a long time loading to get your results after a session. 

I hope they can fix this soon!
title: App issues

author: ssilfan
review: App has gotten completely glitchy. Have to click buttons multiple times to get to training session (get dropped back several times). Just completed a training session and after finishing it just go back to starting a new one without recording results. Apart from that there is the problem that the measurement method constantly seems to change. Whenever I I think I get a hold of how to control the ball, the criteria seem to change with a software update and I am starting from square zero again. Very inconsistent and frustrating. Almost ready to give up on the device.
title: Very glitchy experience

author: Lullery
review:
Has helped with focus so much. I do wish there were more games, but for the price, I am very happy with it! 

I use to supplement my in office neurofeedback, as I can afford to go in as much anymore. Mendi is a cost effective way to get those benefits!!!
title: Love!!!

author: publicdoename
review:
I Love My MENDI. 

I‚Äôm giving four stars for now because the app has room for growth. Custom durations PLEASE PLEASE
PLEASE. Obviously, new practice games.  An API for devs. 

I LOVE MY MENDI

Does It Work? You betcha. Best meditations of my life. You so won‚Äôt be sorry if you buy a Mendi. 

If used regularly, you will wonder how you ever lived without this tool. I almost purchased a different kind of BCI. I chose MENDI (Best decision). In time, I‚Äôm sure I will try other products but I‚Äôm confident MENDI will always be my go to for my main practice. I suffer from ADHD and severe anxiety which means the typical medications. Been on them for years yet I‚Äôve never felt as good as I do right now. 
I Love My MENDI

In February, the one preceding the original March pandemic madness, I lost my mother to cancer. She was my mom, rock, and she was my best friend too. I‚Äôm 41 now and have not had a job for 15 years or drove a car in who knows. Up to last year I had never lived alone. I‚Äôd never lived outside of the house I grew up in. My entire life has been fighting my mental health issues. Now  I‚Äôm a child trying to learn how to live like an adult. It isn‚Äôt easy. I have practiced a lot over the years but never long-term habit before. I look forward to time using MEMDI Then I met MENDI.

 I LOVE MY MENDI. 

I thank everyone at MENDI for this product. I don‚Äôt know how I could ever express my gratitude. You guys saved my life. Anything I can do to help
you guys, I‚Äôd be honored. I‚Äôd be happy to take part in any beta testing, clinical studies, research studies, learning paths, whatever it be. 

I Love My Mendi
title: Umm‚Ä¶who was I 3 months ago?

author: Sudoku user2011
review: Stuck on the first page and can‚Äôt set it up beyond adding Email ID
title: App not working!

author: JeezyFoSheezy
review: Please fix this ASAP it's nearly unusable.
title: App is stuck in portrait mode!!

review: The game doesn‚Äôt load correctly when i start it from the app. It‚Äôs inverted and stuck in portrait mode. I have to restart the app multiple times.
title: Game doesnt load correctly

author: fdbixler
review: My Mendi was delivered on Wednesday, July 7, 2021. Arrived it perfect condition, well packaged, beautifully made, and was a snap to setup. It took seconds for it to locate and connect with the free app. In fact, it took longer to download the app than it took to setup and begin using.  Entire process is incredibly intuitive. Having only been three days, it‚Äôs too soon to boast about any improvements, but I am certain I am feeling something going on in my head. Having read about the benefits of neuro-feedback in the book, ‚ÄúThe Body Keeps The Score,‚Äù by Bessel Van der Kolk MD, I am excited by the possibilities of the benefits of consistent daily practice with Mendi. I have high hopes for this device and its training.
title: Arrived!

author: Leo Fassbender
review: Sound theory and good user experience!
title: Great tool
